intro: Ranunculus sublinearis, commonly known as the slender buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with five to eight petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive lobed or notched appearance. Ranunculus sublinearis prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks.
